issue.title: Add an exception for intellimize domains?
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Hello, I noticed that the adguard-bot [identified](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/98907) intellimize.co spyware and added it to the list of [third party tracking servers](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/1a7010e7c9362cd40b1bfd2e5f0ce49f4f90639c).

This is not a tracking service, but is a [personalization tool](https://www.intellimize.com/). What is the process for getting an exception?

### Proposed solution

Add all intellimize domains to the whitelist

### Additional information

_No response_

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/141393#issuecomment-1409898717 установите AdGuard Extra.

---

This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

issue.title: Add an exception for intellimize domains?
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Hello, I noticed that the adguard-bot [identified](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/98907) intellimize.co spyware and added it to the list of [third party tracking servers](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/1a7010e7c9362cd40b1bfd2e5f0ce49f4f90639c).

This is not a tracking service, but is a [personalization tool](https://www.intellimize.com/). What is the process for getting an exception?

### Proposed solution

Add all intellimize domains to the whitelist

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body:
> I noticed that the adguard-bot https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/98907 intellimize.co spyware and added it

AdGuard Bot is not AI to be able to visit a site by itself and detect something (ads, tracking, annoying elements).

> and added it

AdGuard Bot itself does not add, if you check more carefully, Alex-302 of the AdGuard Team approved it as a potential tracker: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/1a7010e7c9362cd40b1bfd2e5f0ce49f4f90639c

As the form does not collect IP addresses it is unlikely we will ever know what kind of human reported it (or its own AI bot other than "AdGuard Bot").

---

To prove how simple is that "AdGuard Bot" you can use form report all broken pages:

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters#report-issues

https://agrd.io/report

Only possible in that form add own github nickname:

 \> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35370833/215709460-0cb5c24d-7dd9-448e-9279-2f45a4ed5c7c.png)  | like in https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/141539
--- | ---


is not same like https://webcompat.com/ report form where possible use account to publish intead as anonymus simple bot ([webcompat-bot](https://github.com/webcompat-bot) - Mozilla Bot).

issue.title: Releases pages on online.anidub.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin 1.46.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

online.anidub.com

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyList, EasyPrivacy, Peter Lowe's Blocklist, Online Malicious URL Blocklist, RU AdList - Counters, Fanboy's Enhanced Tracking List

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

After enabling/disabling filters, I found that problems with `online.anidub.com` caused by `AdGuard Russian filter` when used by `uBlock Origin` with filters I checked above + 6 built-in uBlock filters.
This issue does NOT appear on root pages: online.anidub.com, online.anidub.com/anime_ongoing, online.anidub.com/anime_tv or online.anidub.com/dorama. It appears only on RELEASES pages (like https://online.anidub.com/anime_ongoing/11560-urusei-yatsura.html)
In uBlock AdGuard Russian filter marked as "external/user filter".

The problem: when `AdGuard Russian filter` enabled, all page content just disappeared, leaving a blank page with AniDub's menu panel at the top of the page.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: Check without built in "RU AdList" if isn't correctly disabled (RU AdList - Counters is a diffrent list and they can't be added to do not lost power of websites where don't follow file itself to fix blocked ads/trackers in 24 hours after list was updated).

issue.title: Automatic deletion of closed websites/servers
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Filtering and loading websites becomes slower by time if closed websites/servers are still in the filter list(s). The bigger the size of filter file and the longer the filtering list, the slower blocking and/or loading websites.

### Proposed solution

Please delete closed websites/servers automatically from filter lists offered by AdGuard.

### Additional information

For example the Wikipedia has a bot that checks dead links: https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%A8%D0%B0%D0%B1%D0%BB%D0%BE%D0%BD:%D0%9D%D0%B5%D0%B4%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%82%D1%83%D0%BF%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%8F_%D1%81%D1%81%D1%8B%D0%BB%D0%BA%D0%B0.

comment.body:
In my oragnization seemingly the biggest problem was reading the expiration date from WHOIS.

Apparently hawkeye reported 1 occurrence of a problem with regional (sub)domains - report seemingly closed as repaired.

Of course, I do not mean when the dates are hidden, for example, eu TLD domains.

issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.
